info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 6:39PM CDT until August 22 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of Southwest Jefferson County in Central Alabama.
* WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 639 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.7 and 1.4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwestern Birmingham, Hoover, Bessemer, Hueytown, Fairfield, Pleasant Grove, Midfield, Brighton, Lipscomb, North Johns, Splash Adventure, Concord, McCalla, Promenade Tannehill, McAdory, Bent Brook Golf Club, Dolomite, Bessemer Airport and Lake Cyrus.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
